CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant first stated that he was the owner of a fully furnished house in LOC . However , in his observations of DATE he listed his properties as follows :
( a ) ORG , registration no . DATE , plot no . DATE , sheet / plan XIII/CARDINAL.E.CARDINAL , field with various trees , area : CARDINAL sq . m ;
( b ) ORG , registration no . DATE , plot no . CARDINAL , sheet / plan PERSON and PERSON , inaccessible hilly field , area : CARDINAL sq . m ;
( c ) ORG , registration no . DATE , plot no . CARDINAL , sheet / plan XIII/CARDINAL.W.CARDINAL , inaccessible field with olive trees , area : QUANTITY . m ;
( d ) ORG , registration no . DATE , plot no . CARDINAL , sheet / plan XII/CARDINAL.E.CARDINAL , field with small former farmhouse and stables , area : CARDINAL sq . m ;
( e ) ORG , registration no . DATE , plot nos . CARDINAL and GPE , sheet / plan XIII/CARDINAL.E.CARDINAL , inaccessible field with CARDINAL olive trees , area : CARDINAL sq . m.

CARDINAL . An expert appointed by the applicant conducted researches in the NORP lands registers and obtained the above registration numbers and references . In support of his claim of ownership , the applicant submitted a survey map on which his properties were marked in yellow .

CARDINAL . Moreover , in an affidavit of CARDINAL DATE the applicant stated that from the time he was born he had lived with his parents in their home in ORG . When he got married in DATE he moved to his wife ’s house in GPE , a village which had never been occupied by NORP military forces . After his marriage , the applicant used to spend weekends and holidays in ORG .

CARDINAL . As a result of the DATE NORP military intervention the applicant had been deprived of his property rights , his properties being located in the area which was under the occupation and overall control of the NORP military authorities . The latter had prevented him from having access to and using his property and his GPE house located in ORG . Moreover , the applicant stated that his house had been occupied by officers and/or other members of the NORP military forces .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant made an attempt to return to his property in ORG by participating in a convoy of cars of fellow refugees from the same district wishing to return home during a peaceful march towards their villages .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his fellow refugees , who had informed the Commander of ORG ( ORG ) forces in GPE of their intention , stopped at the checkpoint in the “ buffer zone ” , on the main road linking GPE with ORG and GPE . There , they asked the ORG officer on duty to be allowed to return to their homes , property and villages . They requested the officer to transmit to the NORP military authorities their demand to return to their homes . The officer announced to them that the NORP military authorities had refused their request .
